title: [Lynda] Photographing and Assembling a Lunar Eclipse Composite T
description:
[Lynda] Photographing and Assembling a Lunar Eclipse Composite Tutorial-KTR
============================================================================


PUBLISHER....: Lynda
LANGUAGE......: ENGLISH 
AUTHOR.......: Paul D. Sheriff



About this course::

A lunar eclipse is a relatively common astronomical event that always brings out the cameras and the long telephoto lenses But the next time a lunar eclipse comes around, go beyond just taking a close-up of a darkened moon. Create a composite that shows the phases of the eclipse and better still, shows the composite in the context of the landscape underneath it That's what photographer and educator Se n Duggan did, and in this course, he deconstructs his photographic steps and post-processing procedures.

The course begins with advice on how to plan and photograph the eclipse, with the right gear, the right focusing techniques, and the right exposure. Next, Se n evaluates the images in Lightroom and then dives into Photoshop and shows how to composite each image into a finished photo. Along the way, he explores blend modes, layer masking, and other compositing techniques.


Topics include:

1.Introduction

2.Planning and Preparation

3.On Location Shooting the Eclipse

4.Processing the Moon Shots

5.Processing the Foreground Landscape Image

6.Adding the Moon Sequence to the Landscape

7.Conclusion
